result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joy DS Boyd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joy DS Boyd in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Joy DS Boyd.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joy DS Boyd appeared by phone.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Joy DS Boyd.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Victim appeared in person.  Discussion placed on the record regarding court order.  Court orders defendant to appear in person at next court and be in compliance with all court orders.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ORDER REGARDING BAIL CONDITIONS:
WHEREAS, on June 27, 2022, in Milwaukee County, Court Case No.: 2022FA001424, RJG vs. Joy Boyd, the Hon. Janet Protasiewicz made the following orders regarding the custody and placement of child AG (06/07/2017):

- Father, RJG, shall have sole legal custody and primary placement of AG on a temporary
basis.
- RJG's placement shall begin June 29, 2022 by 5:00 PM.
- On June 29, 2022 at 5:00 PM, RJG should travel to Florida to pick up AG.
- Defendant Joy Boyd's placement shall only be at reasonable times upon reasonable
notice with 24 hour prior notice.
- All visits by RJG are to be exercised in Wisconsin.

WHEREAS on September 9, 2022, the Court was informed by RJG that the defendant continues to not follow the court order in 2022FA001424.

NOW, THEREFORE, the Court hereby makes the following modifications to bail conditions:
1. The defendant is to have no violent contact with RJG.
2. The defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons.
3. The defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
4. The defendant is turned over to Justice Point at Level 2.
5. The defendant must follow all other court orders, specifically including the court order
regarding custody and placement of AG in 2022FA001424.

BY THE COURT: It is so ordered.

ADDRESS INFO for Joy DS Boyd
Current: 2230 4th St, Mulberry, FL 33860 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2022)
Prior: 14611 Mark Twain Street, Detroit, MI 48227

Defendant Joy DS Boyd appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits.

Victim RB appeared in Court.  Court will modify conditions of bail which state will submit as an order.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant also ordered to follow all court orders arising from case 22FA1424. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/14/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Joy DS Boyd in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Annie Louk, along with student intern Madaline Witte under the student practice rule, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 41.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant

BRANCH 29 HEARD CASE ON BEHALF OF BR 35.
Defendant Joy DS Boyd not in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Further Proceedings. All parties appeared via zoom. Court withdraws issued bench warrant.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
